plugins.name: Mendly â€” Merge & Fix Broken Variables
plugins.description:
**Streamline your design system maintenance with powerful variable management tools.**


## Key Features


**ğŸ”„ Smart Variable Merging**

- Combine duplicate color variables into one

- Automatically updates all references throughout your design

- Preserves semantic variable relationships

- Optional renaming during merge process


**ğŸ”§ Broken Variable Detection & Repair**

- Scans current page for broken variable references

- Smart suggestions based on variable naming patterns

- Navigate between elements using the same broken variable

- Batch fix multiple variables at once


**âš¡ Intelligent Analysis**

- Shows direct vs semantic variable usage

- Counts affected elements before merging

- Identifies variable dependencies

- Context-aware replacement suggestions


**ğŸ¯ Perfect For**

- Design system cleanup and maintenance

- Removing duplicate variables after design updates

- Fixing broken references after variable deletions

- Streamlining color variable organization


**ğŸ’¡ How It Works**

1. Select source variable (will be removed) and target variable (will remain)

2. Preview affected elements and usage statistics

3. Merge variables with one click - all references automatically update

4. Use the fix tool to repair any broken variable links


Save hours of manual work and keep your design system clean and organized!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly merge duplicate variables and fix broken references in your design system.

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

OVERVIEW


The Variable Remapper is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline design system management by enabling seamless migration and remapping of variables between different libraries and collections. This tool is essential for teams managing complex design systems, migrating between libraries, or consolidating variable usage across projects.


CORE CAPABILITIES


Variable Remapping

The plugin provides comprehensive bulk variable migration capabilities, automatically remapping variables from one library to another across entire design systems. The intelligent name matching system matches variables between source and target libraries based on name similarity, reducing manual configuration requirements.

Users can exercise precise scope control by choosing to remap variables across selected objects only, the current page, or all pages in the document. Additionally, collection-specific remapping allows filtering to specific variable collections for granular control over migration processes.


Variable Analysis and Mapping

The system offers comprehensive variable listing functionality to scan and catalog all variable bindings throughout designs. The detailed view presents every variable binding with complete contextual information, including node names and types, bound properties such as fills, strokes, effects, and dimensions, current variable names and sources, plus complete library and collection information.

The grouped view consolidates similar variable bindings for streamlined bulk management operations, while the interactive mapping table enables manual specification of target variables for precise control over remapping processes.


Library Management

The plugin provides robust multi-library support, working seamlessly with local variables in current files, team library variables, and remote libraries. Automatic library detection identifies variable sources and displays comprehensive library information throughout the interface.

Users can browse through variable collections with detailed counts and metadata, supported by real-time loading of library collections and variables for immediate access to current information.


KEY FEATURES


Precision Control

The plugin supports comprehensive property-level binding across all Figma variable binding types, including color variables for fills and strokes, dimension variables for width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight, effect variables for opacity, rotation, and positioning, and boolean variables for visibility controls.

Advanced array property support handles complex bindings such as multiple fills or effects, while safe remapping functionality validates target variables before applying changes to ensure data integrity throughout the migration process.


Advanced Analysis

The binding discovery system automatically identifies all variable bindings across complex node hierarchies, providing complete visibility into variable usage patterns. Source attribution functionality shows exactly where each variable originates, whether from the current file, specific team library names, or remote libraries.

Collection context displays variable collection names for improved organization and understanding of variable relationships throughout the design system.


User Experience

The tabbed interface provides clean separation between remapping and analysis functions, enabling focused workflows for different use cases. Real-time feedback includes loading states, progress indicators, and detailed status messages to keep users informed throughout operations.

Comprehensive error handling delivers actionable feedback when issues arise, while the modern user interface utilizes Figma-native styling with responsive design principles for seamless integration with existing workflows.


USE CASES


Design System Migration

Organizations can migrate from deprecated variable libraries to updated versions, consolidate multiple libraries into a single source of truth, and update variable references when reorganizing design systems. This capability is essential for maintaining consistency during design system evolution and reducing technical debt.


Theme Management

Teams can efficiently switch between light and dark theme variables, apply brand-specific variable sets across different product lines, and test various variable configurations during design exploration phases. This functionality supports rapid iteration and brand consistency maintenance.


Cleanup and Optimization

The plugin enables identification of unused or orphaned variable bindings, standardization of variable usage across teams, and comprehensive auditing of variable implementation across large-scale projects. These capabilities support design system hygiene and optimization efforts.


Workflow Automation

Organizations can batch update variable references during design system updates, streamline handoff processes between design and development teams, and maintain consistency across multiple Figma files. This automation reduces manual work and minimizes human error in variable management processes.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design system by bulk remapping variables across libraries, pages, and components.

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes â€“ done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies â€” ready to share, without the hassle

plugins.name: PureImage Export
plugins.description:
PureImage Export saves you the hassle of removing Corner radius and Effects when exporting images in Figma. With this plugin, you can easily export optimized images without the need for manual adjustments.


PureImage Export Features

ğŸ§¹ Remove Corner Radius & Effects

ğŸ” Preview Display

ğŸ“ Bulk Download Multiple Layers


How to Use:

  1. Select the layer with a Corner radius or Effects applied.
  2. Set up the export (default settings work fine too).
  3. Execute the PureImage Export.
  4. Set the Corner radius/Effects and click [Export as [file format]].


Recommended For:

  1. Anyone who needs to export optimized images from Figma for web development.
  2. Web designers and frontend developers who want to easily export and import images from Figma.

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the pageâ€™s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precisionâ€”all without leaving your design files.


âœ“ Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

âœ“ Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

âœ“ Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

âœ“ Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interfaceâ€”whether human or AI-designedâ€”ensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
plugins.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

plugins.name: QR Code Generator
plugins.description:
Generate QR codes without leaving Figma. Customize with your own link, logo and colors.


This plugin creates static QR codes in SVG format, so they can be resized without losing quality. It uses RecodeQR to generate the image (no account needed). The QR codes are fully self-contained: they donâ€™t rely on our service and theyâ€™re yours forever.


Tip: To scan QR codes you can use the camera app on iOS, or you can also inspect them online.
